perturbation.original_text:
4.1 Short Term Rolling Forecasts
Commencing on the Effective Date, Customer shall provide to Supplier on a calendar quarterly basis on or before the last Business Day of each
calendar quarter during the Term, a short term rolling forecast for the [* * *] period commencing on the first day of the following calendar month
(each, a “Short Term Rolling Forecast”). Each Short Term Rolling Forecast shall set out Customer’s reasonable and genuine estimate of the
quantities of the Product to be ordered by Customer and to be delivered by Supplier under this Agreement for the following [* * *].
(A): In case of an order volume equal or less than [* * *]: The first [* * *] of each short term rolling forecast shall be binding firm purchase orders
by Customer (each a “Purchase Order”) and the last [* * *] of each short term rolling forecast shall be non-binding, good faith estimates. Customer
shall provide Supplier with one or more Purchase Order(s) for Product consistent with the first [* * *] binding portion of each Short Term Rolling
Forecast, at least [* * *] in advance of the scheduled delivery dates provided in such Purchase Order(s).
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 Short Term Rolling Forecasts
Commencing on the Effective Date, Customer shall provide to Supplier on a calendar quarterly basis on or before the last Business Day of each
calendar quarter during the Term, a short term rolling forecast for the [* * *] period commencing on the first day of the following calendar month
(each, a “Short Term Rolling Forecast”). Each Short Term Rolling Forecast shall set out Customer’s reasonable and genuine estimate of the
quantities of the Product to be ordered by Customer and to be delivered by Supplier under this Agreement for the following [* * *].
(A): In case of an order volume equal or less than [* * *]: The entirety of each short term rolling forecast shall be binding firm purchase orders
by Customer (each a “Purchase Order”). Customer
shall provide Supplier with one or more Purchase Order(s) for Product consistent with the entirety of each Short Term Rolling
Forecast, at least [* * *] in advance of the scheduled delivery dates provided in such Purchase Order(s).
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by stating that the entirety of each short term rolling forecast shall be binding firm purchase orders. This contradicts the original by removing the ability of good faith estimates.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Release Testing
a) Supplier shall perform release testing of all batches of Product prior to delivery to Customer in accordance with the Product Specifications and
the Master Batch Record, to determine whether such batches of Product meet the requirements set out in the Product Specifications. Customer
shall be responsible for the final release of Product prior to shipping and further processing.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Release Testing
a) Supplier shall perform release testing of all batches of Product prior to delivery to Customer in accordance with the Product Specifications and
the Master Batch Record, to determine whether such batches of Product meet the requirements set out in the Product Specifications. Supplier
shall be responsible for the final release of Product prior to shipping and further processing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the customer is responsible for the final release. Modifying this line to state that the supplier is responsible contradicts the previous statement.

perturbation.original_text:
12.6 Duration of Obligation
Unless otherwise agreed by the Parties in writing, the obligations of the Parties relating to Confidential Information set out in this Article 12 shall
survive the termination of this Agreement for a period of [* * *].
perturbation.changed_text:
12.6 Duration of Obligation
Unless otherwise agreed by the Parties in writing, the obligations of the Parties relating to Confidential Information set out in this Article 12 shall
survive the termination of this Agreement indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: The change removes a definite end to the confidentiality obligations, now stating they last indefinitely, contradicting the original term limitation.
